questions.text: If 'GATE' is coded as 'HBUF', then 'EXAM' will be coded as:
In a class of 60 students, 30 play cricket, 25 play football and 10 play both. How many play neither?
The ratio of boys to girls in a class is 3:2. If there are 45 students, how many are girls?
Complete the series: 2, 6, 12, 20, 30, ?
If A is taller than B, and B is taller than C, then:
The average of 5 numbers is 20. If one number is excluded, the average becomes 18. What is the excluded number?
A train travels 60 km in 1 hour. How far will it travel in 2.5 hours at the same speed?
If 20% of x is 40, then x is:
The sum of three consecutive odd numbers is 63. What is the largest number?
In a certain code, COMPUTER is written as RFUVQNPC. How is SCIENCE written?
What is the derivative of x^3 + 2x^2 + 5?
The probability of getting a sum of 7 when two dice are thrown is:
What is the determinant of [[1,2],[3,4]]?
The integral of 1/x dx is:
In a normal distribution, what percentage of data falls within 1 standard deviation?
What is the rank of a 3x3 identity matrix?
The eigenvalues of [[2,0],[0,3]] are:
What is lim(x→0) (sin x)/x?
The number of edges in a complete graph with n vertices is:
What is the value of e^(iπ) + 1?
The Laplace transform of e^(at) is:
What is the chromatic number of a complete graph K5?
The solution to dy/dx = y is:

Which data structure is used for BFS traversal?
What is the worst case time complexity of Quick Sort?
In a max heap with n elements, what is the time to find minimum?

What is the time complexity of Dijkstra's algorithm using binary heap?

Which algorithm is used to find strongly connected components?
What is the height of a complete binary tree with n nodes?
Time complexity of Floyd-Warshall algorithm:

Which scheduling algorithm can cause starvation?
What is the purpose of TLB?
Which page replacement algorithm suffers from Belady's anomaly?

Which system call creates a new process?
Banker's algorithm is used for:
Which condition is NOT necessary for deadlock?
What is internal fragmentation?

What is a race condition?
Which normal form eliminates transitive dependencies?
What is a candidate key?

Which isolation level has highest consistency?
Maximum superkeys for relation with n attributes:
What is a lossy decomposition?
Which command modifies table structure?
Purpose of indexing:
Efficiency of pure ALOHA:
Which layer does error detection?
Subnet mask for /24 network:
Purpose of NAT:
Which protocol uses sliding window?
Purpose of ARP:
Which language is NOT context-free?
Which problem is decidable?
Pumping lemma constant for regular languages:
Which parser is most powerful?
Purpose of semantic analysis:
How many minterms for n variables?
What is the worst-case time complexity of inserting an element in a binary search tree?
questions.explanation: In the worst case (skewed tree), insertion takes O(n) time.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: Which data structure is used for implementing recursion?
questions.explanation: Recursion uses the call stack to store function calls.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: What is the space complexity of BFS traversal?
questions.explanation: BFS uses a queue that can store all nodes at a level, requiring O(n) space.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: Which sorting algorithm has the best average-case time complexity?
questions.explanation: Merge Sort has O(n log n) average-case complexity.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: What is the time complexity of the Knapsack problem using dynamic programming?
questions.explanation: DP solution for 0/1 Knapsack has O(nW) complexity where n is items and W is capacity.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: Which scheduling algorithm can cause starvation?
questions.explanation: Low priority processes may never execute if high priority processes keep arriving.
questions.subject: Operating Systems

questions.text: What is thrashing in operating systems?
questions.explanation: Thrashing occurs when a system spends more time paging than executing.
questions.subject: Operating Systems

questions.text: What is the recurrence relation for Merge Sort?
questions.explanation: Merge Sort divides array into two halves and merges them.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: Which algorithm is used to find the shortest path in a weighted graph?
questions.explanation: Dijkstra's algorithm finds shortest paths from source to all vertices.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: What is the time complexity of the Floyd-Warshall algorithm?
questions.explanation: Floyd-Warshall uses three nested loops over all vertices.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: Which sorting algorithm is stable and has O(n log n) complexity?
questions.explanation: Merge Sort maintains relative order of equal elements.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: What is the optimal substructure property in dynamic programming?
options: Problem can be divided into subproblems
Optimal solution contains optimal solutions to subproblems
questions.correctAnswer: Optimal solution contains optimal solutions to subproblems
questions.explanation: Optimal substructure means optimal solution is built from optimal solutions of subproblems.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: What is the maximum number of nodes at level L in a binary tree?
questions.explanation: At level L, maximum nodes = 2^L (assuming root is at level 0).
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: Which data structure is used in Breadth First Search?
questions.explanation: BFS uses FIFO queue to explore nodes level by level.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: What is the height of a complete binary tree with n nodes?
questions.explanation: Height of complete binary tree is floor(log2(n)).
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: Which operation is NOT efficient in a singly linked list?
questions.explanation: Accessing last element requires O(n) traversal in singly linked list.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: What is the time complexity of building a heap from n elements?
questions.explanation: Building a heap using bottom-up approach takes O(n) time.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: What is the purpose of the Translation Lookaside Buffer (TLB)?
options: Speed up virtual to physical address translation
questions.correctAnswer: Speed up virtual to physical address translation
questions.explanation: TLB caches recent virtual-to-physical address translations.
questions.subject: Operating Systems

questions.text: Which page replacement algorithm suffers from Belady's anomaly?
questions.explanation: FIFO can have more page faults with more frames (Belady's anomaly).
questions.subject: Operating Systems

questions.text: What is a race condition?
options: Multiple processes accessing shared data simultaneously
questions.correctAnswer: Multiple processes accessing shared data simultaneously
questions.explanation: Race condition occurs when outcome depends on timing of uncontrollable events.
questions.subject: Operating Systems

questions.text: Which scheduling algorithm gives minimum average waiting time?
questions.explanation: Shortest Job First minimizes average waiting time.
questions.subject: Operating Systems

questions.text: What is the main advantage of multi-threading?
questions.explanation: Threads share resources and allow better CPU utilization.
questions.subject: Operating Systems

questions.text: What is the highest normal form?
questions.explanation: 5NF (Fifth Normal Form) or PJNF is the highest normal form.
questions.subject: DBMS

questions.text: Which isolation level prevents dirty reads?
questions.explanation: Read Committed prevents reading uncommitted data.
questions.subject: DBMS

questions.text: What is a candidate key?
questions.explanation: Candidate key is a minimal set of attributes that uniquely identifies tuples.
questions.subject: DBMS

questions.text: Which join returns all rows from both tables?
questions.explanation: Full Outer Join returns all rows from both tables with NULLs for non-matching rows.
questions.subject: DBMS

questions.text: What is the purpose of indexing in databases?
questions.explanation: Indexes speed up data retrieval operations.
questions.subject: DBMS

questions.text: Which layer of OSI model handles routing?
questions.explanation: Network layer (Layer 3) handles routing and logical addressing.
questions.subject: Computer Networks

questions.text: What is the maximum size of TCP header?
questions.explanation: TCP header can be 20-60 bytes (20 bytes fixed + 40 bytes options).
questions.subject: Computer Networks

questions.text: Which protocol is used for email transmission?
questions.explanation: SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) is used to send emails.
questions.subject: Computer Networks

questions.text: What is the purpose of ARP?
questions.explanation: ARP (Address Resolution Protocol) maps IP addresses to MAC addresses.
questions.subject: Computer Networks

questions.text: Which routing algorithm is used by OSPF?
questions.explanation: OSPF uses Link State routing algorithm.
questions.subject: Computer Networks

questions.text: What is the time complexity of finding the median of two sorted arrays of size n each?
questions.explanation: Using binary search approach, we can find median in O(log n) time.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: Which algorithm is used to find strongly connected components in a directed graph?
questions.explanation: Kosaraju's algorithm uses two DFS passes to find SCCs.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: What is the worst-case time complexity of QuickSort?
questions.explanation: QuickSort has O(n²) worst case when pivot is always smallest or largest element.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: Which data structure is used in Dijkstra's algorithm for efficient implementation?
questions.explanation: Min heap (priority queue) gives O((V+E) log V) complexity.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: What is the optimal time complexity for matrix chain multiplication using dynamic programming?
questions.explanation: DP solution requires three nested loops, giving O(n³) complexity.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: What is the minimum number of queues needed to implement a stack?
questions.explanation: Two queues are needed to implement stack operations efficiently.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: In a binary heap with n elements, what is the time complexity to build the heap?
questions.explanation: Bottom-up heap construction takes O(n) time.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: What is the maximum number of edges in a simple undirected graph with n vertices?
questions.explanation: Complete graph has n(n-1)/2 edges.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: Which traversal of a binary tree gives nodes in non-decreasing order for a BST?
questions.explanation: Inorder traversal of BST gives sorted sequence.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: What is the time complexity of searching in a balanced AVL tree with n nodes?
questions.explanation: AVL tree maintains O(log n) height, giving O(log n) search.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: Which page replacement algorithm suffers from Belady's anomaly?
questions.explanation: FIFO can have more page faults with more frames.
questions.subject: Operating Systems

questions.text: What is the purpose of semaphores in operating systems?
questions.explanation: Semaphores are used for process synchronization and mutual exclusion.
questions.subject: Operating Systems

questions.text: In a system with 4 processes and 3 resource types, what is the maximum size of the allocation matrix?
questions.explanation: Allocation matrix has rows for processes and columns for resources.
questions.subject: Operating Systems

questions.text: Which scheduling algorithm gives minimum average waiting time?
questions.explanation: Shortest Job First minimizes average waiting time.
questions.subject: Operating Systems

questions.text: What is thrashing in an operating system?
questions.explanation: Thrashing occurs when system spends more time paging than executing.
questions.subject: Operating Systems

questions.text: Which normal form eliminates transitive dependencies?
questions.explanation: Third Normal Form removes transitive dependencies.
questions.subject: DBMS

questions.text: What is the maximum number of superkeys possible for a relation with n attributes?
questions.explanation: Any subset containing a candidate key is a superkey.
questions.subject: DBMS

questions.text: Which isolation level prevents dirty reads?
questions.explanation: Read Committed prevents reading uncommitted data.
questions.subject: DBMS

questions.text: What is the purpose of indexing in databases?
questions.explanation: Indexes speed up data retrieval operations.
questions.subject: DBMS

questions.text: Which join returns all rows from both tables?
questions.explanation: Full Outer Join returns all rows with NULLs for non-matching.
questions.subject: DBMS

questions.text: Which layer of OSI model handles end-to-end communication?
questions.explanation: Transport layer provides end-to-end communication services.
questions.subject: Computer Networks

questions.text: What is the maximum size of TCP window in bytes?
questions.explanation: TCP window size field is 16 bits, max = 2¹⁶ = 64 KB.
questions.subject: Computer Networks

questions.text: Which protocol is used for dynamic IP address assignment?
questions.explanation: DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol) assigns IP addresses.
questions.subject: Computer Networks

questions.text: What is the purpose of ARP?
questions.explanation: ARP maps IP addresses to MAC addresses.
questions.subject: Computer Networks

questions.text: Which routing algorithm is used by OSPF?
questions.explanation: OSPF uses Link State routing algorithm.
questions.subject: Computer Networks

questions.text: What is the number of comparisons required to sort 8 elements using merge sort?
questions.explanation: Merge sort requires n*log(n) - n + 1 comparisons = 8*3 - 8 + 1 = 18
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: Which sorting algorithm is stable and has O(n log n) worst-case complexity?
questions.explanation: Merge Sort is stable and has O(n log n) worst case.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: What is the best case time complexity of Bubble Sort?
questions.explanation: Best case occurs when array is already sorted.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: What is the time complexity of Bellman-Ford algorithm?
questions.explanation: Bellman-Ford relaxes all edges V-1 times.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: Which algorithm finds minimum spanning tree in O(E log E)?
questions.explanation: Kruskal's sorts edges and uses union-find.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: What is the maximum number of edges in a DAG with n vertices?
questions.explanation: DAG can have at most complete graph edges.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: What is the time complexity of 0/1 Knapsack using DP?
questions.explanation: DP table size is n×W where W is capacity.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: Which problem exhibits optimal substructure?
questions.explanation: Both have optimal substructure property.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: Which problem cannot be solved optimally using greedy approach?
questions.explanation: 0/1 Knapsack requires DP, not greedy.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: What is the time complexity of Huffman coding?
questions.explanation: Building heap and extracting min takes O(n log n).
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: What is the recurrence for binary search?
questions.explanation: Binary search divides problem in half with constant work.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: Using Master theorem, what is complexity of T(n) = 4T(n/2) + n²?
questions.explanation: Case 2 of Master theorem applies.
questions.subject: Algorithms

questions.text: What is the time complexity to insert at the beginning of a singly linked list?
questions.explanation: Insertion at head is constant time.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: What is the space complexity of storing a sparse matrix using linked list?
questions.explanation: Only non-zero elements (k) are stored.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: What is the minimum number of stacks needed to implement a queue?
questions.explanation: Two stacks can simulate queue operations.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: What is the time complexity of enqueue operation in a circular queue?
questions.explanation: Enqueue is constant time with proper implementation.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: What is the maximum height of an AVL tree with 7 nodes?
questions.explanation: AVL tree with 7 nodes has max height 3.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: How many structurally different BSTs are possible with 3 nodes?
questions.explanation: Catalan number C(3) = 5.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: What is the time complexity of finding kth smallest element in BST?
questions.explanation: Inorder traversal until kth element.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: What is the time complexity to delete an arbitrary element from a binary heap?
questions.explanation: Finding element takes O(n), then O(log n) to delete.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: What is the minimum number of comparisons to build a heap of n elements?
questions.explanation: Bottom-up heap construction uses at most 2n comparisons.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: What is the space complexity of adjacency matrix for a graph with V vertices?
questions.explanation: Matrix requires V×V space.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: What is the time complexity of DFS on a graph with V vertices and E edges?
questions.explanation: DFS visits all vertices and edges once.
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: What is the expected time complexity of search in a hash table with chaining?
questions.explanation: α is the load factor (n/m).
questions.subject: Data Structures

questions.text: Which collision resolution technique has best cache performance?
questions.explanation: Linear probing has better cache locality.
questions.subject: Data Structures
